result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby R Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Abandon Animal, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.15.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the sentence may be served with huber.  Court grants out of county travel and out of county service.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Talked with Agent Tracy Woods, a hearing was held on 10/05/2017 in front of an Administrative Judge in regards to revocation.  On October 9, 2017 the decision was received, the defendant will be revoked.
43

2:08 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Tracy Woods not present in court.  Statement by defendant, has been making payments on these cases.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation on each case for a period of 1 year.  Court has no objection to the defendant discharging if all monies are paid.  Court instructs defendant that if probation needs to be extended again, the court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain an attorney.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 26, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant called and requested an adjournment as he will be out on a business trip all week.  Approved.  Matter rescheduled to June 26, 2017 at 2:00 p.m.
43
Probation review hearing on June 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
1:38 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2015CM169 and count 1 on 2016CF5 amended to misdemeanor bail jumping and 2015CF109 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2015CM169 and count 1 as amended to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping on 2016CF5.  Court orders 2015CF109 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM169

-60 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.  If served, with huber and out of county travel and out of county service.

2016CF5 

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS (BOTH CASES):

-Court costs. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
